basics.name: Glen Barcelo
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Engineering in the Department of Electrical Engineering at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Fall, 2019.

highlights: Proposed, researched, and implemented object recognition models that were trained using ad-hoc data to localize and classify haole koa parts and general plant parts
Applied Python and TensorFlow in Linux

work.position: Project/Design Lead, Software Lead, Hardware/Mechanical Integrator
highlights: Proposed, designed, and developed a quadrupedal robot that learns to walk in a direction using a neural network observing leg states/actions and distance measurements
Applied Arduino technologies, Bluetooth, TensorFlow, Python, and C/C++

Designed and implemented an Android App with the safety theme. User presses a button when in a possibly dangerous environment (e.g. walking to a vehicle alone at night). App uses GPS to create a trail of locations with time stamps and, upon unintended release of the button, will send a text to an emergency contact with a canned message and link to Google Maps with location. Brainstormed, designed, and implemented by a team of three in seven days (duration of competition). Second place prize.

work.summary: Personal Project: Garage Door Wireless Control (2017)
highlights: Designed and implemented a wireless control for a garage door motor using information primarily from open source designs and Arduino tutorials. Major components include: HC-06 Bluetooth Module, Adafruit Trinket (Arduino), Relay.
Arduino accepts input through an Android app at the press of a button.
